meanings.definition: Belonging to the same time period.
meanings.sent1: The painting had a contemporary style, fitting in perfectly with the other artworks from the same era.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied contemporary documents to understand the events of that time.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the contemporary fashion trends making a comeback.
meanings.sent4: The contemporary music scene is a melting pot of different genres and influences.
meanings.sent5: The contemporary architecture of the building stood out among the older structures.

meanings.definition: A person living or existing at the same time as another.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor is a contemporary of mine, always sharing stories from our childhood.
meanings.sent2: The artist found inspiration in the works of his contemporaries.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to think that my pet turtle could be considered a contemporary of the dinosaurs.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, everyone seemed like a contemporary, rushing to their destinations.
meanings.sent5: The author dedicated her book to her contemporaries who supported her throughout her career.

meanings.definition: Modern or current in style or design.
meanings.sent1: The contemporary furniture in the room gave it a sleek and modern look.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer showcased her contemporary collection at the fashion show.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the old car transformed into a contemporary vehicle with new features.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as contemporary as they were innovative, pushing the boundaries of traditional thinking.
meanings.sent5: The contemporary art exhibition drew a diverse crowd of art enthusiasts.
